Hi,

Some years back Derek James and Philip Tucker wrote a paper using NEAT
to do some very simple object recognition (discriminating between two
very basic shapes using a roaming eye approach if memory serves). And
then there's the 'boxes' hyperneat experiment that attempt to
distinguish between a small and large solid square shape.

For cutting edge visual recognition google Deep Belief Networks
(stacked restricted boltzman machines).

Colin.
